Description: Website is missing 6 critical HTTP security headers which increases vulnerability to clickjacking MIME-sniffing XSS attacks and information leakage. Headers missing: X-Frame-Options X-Content-Type-Options X-XSS-Protection Referrer-Policy Content-Security-Policy Permissions-Policy
Steps to Reproduce: (1) Open browser DevTools (2) Navigate to https://x4o.co.za (3) Go to Network tab (4) Select main document request (5) Check Response Headers (6) Verify no X-Frame-Options X-Content-Type-Options X-XSS-Protection Referrer-Policy CSP or Permissions-Policy headers present
Expected Behavior: All 6 security headers should be present with appropriate values: X-Frame-Options: DENY | X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff | X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block | Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin | Content-Security-Policy: (see security report for full policy) | Permissions-Policy: geolocation=() microphone=() camera=()
Actual Behavior: Security headers are missing from HTTP response allowing potential security vulnerabilities
Related Task ID: SEC-004 SEC-005 SEC-006 SEC-007 SEC-008 SEC-009
Testing Notes: Remediation: Create public/_headers file with security headers. Expected fix time: 15 minutes. Will raise security grade from B+ to A.

Bug Title: Clickjacking Vulnerability - Site Can Be Embedded in Iframe
Description: Website can be embedded in malicious iframes due to missing X-Frame-Options header allowing potential clickjacking attacks where users could be tricked into clicking hidden elements
Steps to Reproduce: (1) Create test HTML file with iframe: <iframe src="https://x4o.co.za"></iframe> (2) Open test file in browser (3) Observe that x4o.co.za loads successfully inside iframe
Expected Behavior: Website should refuse to load in iframe and browser console should show error: 'Refused to display in a frame because it set X-Frame-Options to DENY'
Actual Behavior: Website loads normally in iframe with no restrictions allowing potential clickjacking attacks
Testing Notes: This is directly related to BUG-SEC-001 (missing X-Frame-Options header). Fix for BUG-SEC-001 will resolve this issue. Remediation: Add X-Frame-Options: DENY header in public/_headers file.

Description: No robots.txt file present on website which may impact SEO and search engine crawling behavior. While not a security issue this affects discoverability and search engine optimization.
Expected Behavior: robots.txt file should be present with appropriate crawl directives for search engines
Actual Behavior: 404 Not Found - file does not exist
Testing Notes: Phase 7 enhancement task. Not a security issue but flagged during security testing. Should create public/robots.txt with search engine directives.

Description: No sitemap.xml file present on website which may impact SEO by making it harder for search engines to discover and index all pages. While not a security issue this affects search engine optimization.
Expected Behavior: sitemap.xml file should be present listing all website pages for search engines
Actual Behavior: 404 Not Found - file does not exist
Testing Notes: Phase 7 enhancement task. Not a security issue but flagged during security testing. Can use Astro sitemap plugin to auto-generate: npm install @astrojs/sitemap
